H0.text: The Arabic term 'Al-jebr' (reunion of broken parts) is famously associated with. Mathematics

H1.text: The Arabic term 'Al-jebr' (reunion of broken parts) is famously associated with. Surgery

H2.text: The Arabic term 'Al-jebr' (reunion of broken parts) is famously associated with. Archaeology

H3.text: The Arabic term 'Al-jebr' (reunion of broken parts) is famously associated with. ALGEBRA

A4.text: The word algebra comes from the Arabic term الجبر (al-jabr).

A5.text: The word algebra comes from the Arabic term الجبر (al-jabr), which originally referred to the surgical treatment of bonesetting.

A6.text: The term 'algebra' is derived from the name of one of the basic operations with equations (al-jabr, meaning 'restoration', referring to adding a number to both sides of the equation to consolidate or cancel terms) described in this book.

A7.text: Al-jabr is the process of removing negative units, roots and squares from the equation by adding the same quantity to each side.
